content.description: Follow 3 bolts to an airy finish.
content.location: ~100ft left of Lazy Afternoon. Before the boulder that blocks the trail. Scramble up to the pine tree and look left.

content.description: Remember to stretch before this one! Stem your way up until you can pull onto the easy slab on the left. The deeper you go the smaller the stem.
content.location: The chimney to the left of 'Lazy Daze'.

content.description:
Place your first pieces while stemming off the boulder across from route, then pull onto the wind sculpted holds to get established.  Throw in some incredible mid sized nuts from the cool rest, then reach way up and slot a bomber #3 BD nut and bust out the crux heading up and right.  Three bolts up the face get you to the anchor.

 Kinda a brief crux for a 4 star route, but with great gear, great holds and great movement through the v2 boulder problem i think it earns it.
content.protection: nuts and a couple small cams, QD's
content.location: Look for the ever thinning short crack 10' to the right of Around the Corner

content.description: A good variety of climbing all with consistent difficulty and good pro.  Start climbing up to and through the large looking left hand crack.  Place a bomber cam at the top of the flake then traverse out right to the thin left facing crack/shallow dihedral. Protect this with small nuts and cams until you can clip the first bolt, step left, clip one more bolt then the chains.
content.location: 30' left of Floridays, just left of the big tree.

content.description: Climb the slab to gain the chicken heads and dinner plates.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Slings optional for chicken heads.

content.description: Follow the bolts for a good time. Well protected.
content.location: In the center of the formation left of Lazy Afternoon.

content.description: A bit of an oddball awkward route, but worthwhile. Figure out the holds to start, which is easier if you are taller, and gain the very low first bolt; then move up a somewhat awkward right angling continuous seam tackling a series of mini-overhangs on the way up. Inconsistently hard with easier climbing surrounding a couple of harder moves. Good hands with smeary feet most of the way. Finishes with a cruxy layback move off the flake/crack. Falling there without the #1 cam in the crack would probably hurt.
content.protection: Five Bolts. A #1 cam protects the final physical layback move off the flake/crack combo just before the anchors.
content.location: Furthest route to the left on the Main Wall NE face. Has its own anchor. Starts next to a birch tree which can be used as an anchor for the belayer; who is unfortunately positioned on a downward-sloping bed of slick pine needles.

content.description: Cool. Starts on level ground. Pull over a detached flake to gain the bolt line. Vertical Bomber rock and good hands on this one with smeary feet. More fun and flowing than the other routes on this wall. Pull a series of mini- overhangs, work right and then face the crux sequence-- a left angling series of two bulbous bulges. Pulling the first one off good crimps sets you up for the awkward second one that required, at least for me, some funky hand positioning off small biters to pull through and reach the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Shares anchors with Breezy 9+ and Around the Corner 10+ which are farther to the right.
content.location: 2nd route from left on Main Wall NE

content.description: Crux down low, shares Disneyland finish.
content.location: Just right of a flake on the N edge of the formation

content.description: Follow bolts through the steep wind sculpted holds to start (crux).  There is one more tricky move after the holds thin out, but then scamper to the anchor.  The beginning is not as strait forward as you would think.
content.location: 10' left of the thin crack start of Sassy.  Look for the very cool looking sculpted holds

content.description: This is the upper part of the main wall. You encounter this NE wall before the SW wall which hold the classic line Pod'n me. This area is consists of bolted routes up to 60'.
